title: Research condensed message list UI (2-line layout)
description:
Investigate options for a more space-efficient message list display in the TUI. Current 3-line layout is too verbose.

Current layout (3 lines per message):
- Line 1: [Topic] from Sender @ 15:04:05
- Line 2: Payload (truncated)
- Line 3: Session ID (dimmed)

Goal: Condense to 2 lines while preserving key information.

Research:
- Review bubbles list delegate patterns for compact layouts
- Consider what info is most important (topic, payload, time)
- Look at how session delegate handles multi-line rendering
- Determine if session ID is needed or can be shown on hover/selection only
notes:
## Research Findings

### Current Implementation
- `MessageDelegate` (messages_view.go:61-67): Height=3, Spacing=1
- Current layout per message:
  - Line 1: `[Topic] from Sender @ 15:04:05`
  - Line 2: `Payload...` (truncated)
  - Line 3: `session: <id>` (dimmed, only if present)

### Comparison with SessionDelegate
- Height=5, Spacing=1 (more verbose)
- Uses similar border selection pattern

### Recommended 2-Line Layout

**Option A (Minimal change):**
```
Line 1: [Topic] Sender • 15:04:05
Line 2: Payload...
```
- Remove "from" prefix (redundant)
- Use bullet separator like SessionDelegate
- Session ID removed from default view

**Option B (More compact header):**
```
Line 1: [Topic] • Payload preview...
Line 2: Sender @ 15:04:05  session: abc123
```
- Topic + payload on first line (most important info)
- Metadata on second line
- Cons: breaks visual hierarchy

### Recommended Approach: Option A

Changes needed in `messages_view.go`:
1. `Height() int` → return 2 (was 3)
2. `Render()` → remove line3, condense line1

Session ID handling options:
1. **Remove entirely** - simplest, may lose debugging value
2. **Show only when selected** - requires variable height (not well supported by bubbles list)
3. **Show in help/status bar** - requires model changes to track selected message
4. **Show truncated inline** - e.g. `[Topic] Sender • 15:04 • abc12...`

Recommendation: Start with option 1 (remove entirely). Session ID is low-value for most use cases - users can filter by topic/sender instead. If needed later, can add a "details" view.
close_reason: Research complete. Recommended 2-line layout: [Topic] Sender • 15:04:05 on line 1, Payload on line 2. Session ID removed (low value for typical use).

title: Redesign message view with custom compact layout
description:
Replace the bubbles list implementation for messages view with a custom compact layout.

## Current Problem
The bubbles list is too verbose for message display.

## Desired Layout
```
14:32:01 [orders  ] New order received #12849 from cu…       api-gateway
14:31:58 [auth    ] User login successful for user_id…          auth-svc
14:31:45 [system  ] Health check passed                          unknown
14:31:30 [payments] Payment processed: $142.50                payment-svc
14:31:12 [stock   ] Low stock alert: SKU-4421 below t…         inventory
14:30:58 [orders  ] Order status updated to shipped f…       api-gateway
14:30:45 [errors  ] Connection timeout to external se…           unknown
14:30:30 [jobs    ] Scheduled job completed: cleanup_…         scheduler
```

## Requirements
1. **Compact row format**: `timestamp [topic] message_preview sender`
2. **New messages at top**: Newest messages appear first
3. **No borders**: Remove list chrome/borders for cleaner look
4. **Color hashing**: Use deterministic color selection for topics and senders
   - Define a pool of colors
   - Hash topic/sender string to select consistent color
   - Same topic/sender always gets same color
5. **Preserve dialog behavior**: Enter still opens message preview modal
6. **Scrolling**: Support up/down navigation through messages

## Files to modify
- `internal/tui/model.go` - Replace msgList with custom renderer
- `internal/tui/styles.go` - Add color pool and hashing function
- `internal/tui/message_delegate.go` - May be removed or heavily modified

## Implementation Notes
- Consider a simple slice-based model instead of bubbles list
- Track scroll position manually
- Truncate message preview to fit available width
- Right-align sender column
close_reason: Implemented compact message view with custom renderer. Replaced bubbles list with slice-based model, added deterministic color hashing for topics/senders, single-line format with timestamp, topic, preview, and sender columns.

title: Research TUI focus indicator design options
description:
The current focus indicator (▸ and bold title) is too subtle - users accidentally press enter on the wrong pane.

## Failed Approaches
1. **Bordered panes** - Added rounded borders around focused pane. Removed header layout, looked cluttered.
2. **Background tint on header** - Added blue background behind focused header text. Looked awful.

## Research Needed
Look at other TUI applications for inspiration on how they handle split pane focus:
- lazygit
- k9s
- btop/htop
- lazydocker
- Other Bubble Tea apps

## Possible Options to Explore
- Different indicator symbols or positioning
- Underline the focused header
- Color the divider line based on which side is focused
- Subtle highlight on selected list items only in focused pane
- Different approach entirely?

## User Feedback Requested
What visual style would you prefer? Please add notes with examples or preferences.
notes:
## Research Findings

### How Popular TUIs Handle Focus Indication

#### 1. Lazygit / Lazydocker
- **Bright blue border** around the focused pane (lazygotest confirms: 'highlighted with a bright blue border')
- **Highlighted/brighter text** for active items
- Very consistent visual language across all panels
- Navigation: Tab to cycle, h/l or arrows to switch panes, number keys (1-5) for direct access

#### 2. K9s (Kubernetes TUI)
- Uses **configurable focus colors** via skins
- Key styling properties: `focusColor`, `cursorColor`, `highlightColor`
- Border has separate `fgColor` and `focusColor` 
- Allows full theme customization

#### 3. btop/htop
- **Color-coded sections** with distinct visual hierarchy
- **Highlighted keys** are clickable/interactive
- Relies more on section differentiation than active/inactive states
- Uses ASCII art and Unicode for visual clarity

#### 4. Tmux (Reference Pattern)
- **Colorizes separators/dividers** adjacent to active pane
- Inactive panes can be 'slightly greyed'
- Active pane border set to distinct color (commonly blue)
- Windows Terminal adopted similar approach

### Bubble Tea / Lip Gloss Patterns

#### Built-in Focus Support
- `EnableReportFocus` for terminal focus events
- Bubbles library has `Style struct` with focused/unfocused states
- Common pattern: conditional style application based on focus state

#### Border Options Available
- `lipgloss.NormalBorder()` - standard
- `lipgloss.ThickBorder()` - heavier weight
- `lipgloss.DoubleBorder()` - double-line
- `lipgloss.HiddenBorder()` - invisible (useful for unfocused to maintain alignment)
- `BorderForeground()` to colorize

### Design Options to Consider

Based on research, here are the most viable approaches:

#### Option A: Colored Divider (tmux-style)
Change the vertical divider color based on which pane is focused:
- Left focused: divider colored on right side or entire divider blue
- Right focused: divider colored on left side
- Subtle but effective in terminals

#### Option B: Border Accent (lazygit-style)
Add a border to the focused pane only:
- Focused: visible border (blue/accent color)
- Unfocused: hidden border (maintains spacing)
- Clear visual distinction

#### Option C: Title Underline
Underline the focused pane title:
- Less intrusive than borders
- Clear indication of which pane
- Works well with existing arrow indicator

#### Option D: Dimmed Unfocused Pane
Dim/grey out the unfocused pane content:
- Focused: normal colors
- Unfocused: faded/dimmed colors
- Common in IDEs (inactive panels)

#### Option E: Selected Item Differentiation
Only show selection indicator in focused pane:
- Active pane: blue bar on selected item
- Inactive pane: no selection bar shown
- User sees which pane can receive input

### Recommendation

**Option A (Colored Divider)** is the most elegant solution:
1. Minimal visual clutter
2. Proven pattern (tmux, Windows Terminal)
3. Easy to implement with lipgloss
4. Works with existing arrow + bold title indicators

Implementation would be:
```go
// In renderSplitView
var dividerColor lipgloss.Color
if m.focusedPane == PaneSessions {
    dividerColor = colorBlue  // Blue when left focused (divider 'points' right)
} else {
    dividerColor = colorBlue  // Blue when right focused
}
divider := lipgloss.NewStyle().
    Foreground(dividerColor).
    Render(strings.Repeat("│", contentHeight))
```

Or **Option E** could complement this - only showing the selection bar (┃) in the focused pane.
close_reason: Research complete. Documented findings from lazygit, k9s, btop, lazydocker, and tmux. Recommended colored divider approach (Option A) as primary solution.

title: Implement hive msg CLI command
description:
Create the msg command with pub/sub/list subcommands:

hive msg pub --topic <topic> [message | -f file | stdin]
  - Publish message to topic
  - Auto-detect sender from session ID
  
hive msg sub [--topic <pattern>] [--timeout duration] [--last N]
  - No topic: subscribe to all topics
  - With topic: filter by pattern (supports wildcards like agent.*)
  - --last N returns last N messages immediately
  - Without --last, polls for new messages until timeout
  
hive msg list [--json]
  - List all topics with message counts

Follow pattern from cmd_ctx.go for structure.
Location: internal/commands/cmd_msg.go
close_reason: Implemented hive msg CLI with pub/sub/list subcommands, auto sender detection, wildcard topic patterns, and polling for new messages
